newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's New World needs 100,000 PCS subscribers - CEO.
newsitem.headline: HK's New World needs 100,000 PCS subscribers - CEO.

text.p: New World Telephone, a unit of New World Development Ltd, said on Tuesday it would need around 100,000 subscribers to its new Personal Communications Service (PCS) to break even.
"I believe with 100,000 subscribers we are quite safe," Peter Tsang, chief executive of New World Telephone, told a news conference.
New World is planning to launch its PCS service by mid-1997 after being one of six companies to receive licences in Hong Kong in September.
PCS is a digital wireless voice and data communications standard which operates in the 1.7 Ghz to 2.0 Ghz band.
Tsang predicted Hong Kong would have around two million mobile phone subscribers by 2000 and that many would migrate to PCS technology because it would be less congested than other systems.
